description: These falls aren’t the tallest you’ll find in Cape Breton Island but their location is a gem in itself.  Setting off from a gravel road, the brook is hidden by the dense forest on both sides.  I could hear the roar of a small fall and correctly guessed that a culvert under the road was the culprit.  I started to hike downstream following the brook and very soon the brook began to carve a small ravine.  At this point the forest canopy soars overhead as you walk between giant evergreens.  A lush moss carpet cushions each steps.  Pretty soon you will be at a 5 ft.  I wasn’t sure what I was looking for as I was there on a hunch but I decided to push further downstream and was pleasantly rewarded by two 8-10 ft falls.
directions: Cabot Trail in the Glendale area.  Turn on MacLennan Road and follow it by first crossing a new bridge and then passing two houses in the forest before reaching the tributary you need to follow at; N45° 50' 28.9" W61° 15' 29.7"
title: MacLennans Road Falls
